result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Emmanuel D Alcover

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Emmanuel D Alcover in court, in custody.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Emmanuel D Alcover.  Attorney Daniel T Flaherty in court for State of Wisconsin. Joinder motion heard. Court grants joinder for cases 2022CF1806 and 2022CF2921. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions and notice of alibi must be filed by the final pretrial. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion Opposing Joinder.

Defendant Emmanuel D Alcover in court with attorney Colin Patrick McGinn.  Defendant Emmanuel D Alcover in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pretrial. Defense advise of defendant's new case and request vacate of jury trial date. Defense advises defendant wishes to WITHDRAW SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Defendant confirms with court. Court vacates jury trial dates of 8-22-2022 and 9-12-2022. Court acknowledges withdraw of speedy trial demand. Court orders defense reply to joinder due by 9-14-2022. Case adjourned in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion to Join 22CF1806 and 22CF2921 for Jury Trial.
Motion for Forfeiture by Wrongdoing.
Filed: Original Transcript of SCHEDULING CONFERENCE ( 8 pages) commencing 06-28-2022 by WHITNEY R. BERNDT.
Received and Filed: Attorney Colin McGinn
Received and Filed: Attorney Katherine Graber
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.

Attorney Katherine Graber in court, defendant Emmanuel D Alcover not in court, in custody.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Speedy trial deadline 9-12-2022.   Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Any other motions must be filed by the final pretrial. Court set trial date on 8-22-2022 and advises back up trial date of 9-12-2022. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 4.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Defendant Emmanuel D Alcover in court, appear by video. with attorney Katherine Graber, appear in person.  Defendant Emmanuel D Alcover in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took Judical Notice to case 19CF2040. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer K.Baus.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed.

Defendant Emmanuel D Alcover not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Katie Graber to be appointed pending conflict check.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Abigail I.L.; Isabella M.L.; Pedro C.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Emmanuel D Alcover in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Emmanuel D Alcover in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Emmanuel D Alcover appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
